001package io.jstach.kiwi.kvs;
002
003import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
004import java.io.IOException;
005import java.net.URI;
006import java.util.ArrayList;
007import java.util.List;
008import java.util.function.Consumer;
009import java.util.function.Function;
010
011import io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.interpolate.Interpolator.InterpolationException;
012
013/**
014 * Represents a loader responsible for loading {@link KeyValues} from configured sources.
015 * This interface defines the contract for loading key-value pairs, potentially involving
016 * interpolation or resource chaining.
017 *
018 * <p>
019 * Implementations of this interface may load key-values from various sources such as
020 * files, classpath resources, or system properties.
021 *
022 * @see KeyValues
023 * @see Variables
024 */
025public interface KeyValuesLoader {
026
027        /**
028         * Loads key-values from configured sources.
029         * @return a {@link KeyValues} instance containing the loaded key-value pairs
030         * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during loading
031         * @throws FileNotFoundException if a specified resource is not found
032         * @throws InterpolationException if an error occurs during value interpolation
033         */
034        public KeyValues load() throws IOException, FileNotFoundException, InterpolationException;
035
036        /**
037         * A builder class for constructing instances of {@link KeyValuesLoader}. The builder
038         * allows adding multiple sources from which key-values will be loaded, as well as
039         * setting variables for interpolation. <strong>Note that the order of the "add" and
040         * {@link #variables} methods does matter.</strong>
041         */
042        public class Builder implements KeyValuesLoader {
043
044                final Function<Builder, KeyValuesLoader> loaderFactory;
045
046                final List<NamedKeyValuesSource> sources = new ArrayList<>();
047
048                final List<Function<KeyValuesEnvironment, Variables>> variables = new ArrayList<>();
049
050                Builder(Function<Builder, KeyValuesLoader> loaderFactory) {
051                        super();
052                        this.loaderFactory = loaderFactory;
053                }
054
055                /**
056                 * Adds a {@link KeyValuesResource} as a source to the loader.
057                 * @param resource the resource to add
058                 * @return this builder instance
059                 */
060                public Builder add(KeyValuesResource resource) {
061                        sources.add(resource);
062                        return this;
063                }
064
065                /**
066                 * Add resource using callback on builder.
067                 * @param uri uri of resource
068                 * @param builder builder to add additional properties.
069                 * @return this.
070                 */
071                public Builder add(String uri, Consumer<KeyValuesResource.Builder> builder) {
072                        var b = KeyValuesResource.builder(uri);
073                        builder.accept(b);
074                        return add(b.build());
075                }
076
077                /**
078                 * Adds a named {@link KeyValues} source to the loader.
079                 * @param name the name of the source
080                 * @param keyValues the key-values to add
081                 * @return this builder instance
082                 */
083                public Builder add(String name, KeyValues keyValues) {
084                        sources.add(new NamedKeyValues(name, keyValues));
085                        return this;
086                }
087
088                /**
089                 * Adds a {@link URI} as a source by wrapping it in a {@link KeyValuesResource}.
090                 * @param uri the URI to add
091                 * @return this builder instance
092                 */
093                public Builder add(URI uri) {
094                        return add(KeyValuesResource.builder(uri).build());
095                }
096
097                /**
098                 * Adds a URI specified as a string as a source to the loader.
099                 * @param uri the URI string to add
100                 * @return this builder instance
101                 */
102                public Builder add(String uri) {
103                        return add(URI.create(uri));
104                }
105
106                /**
107                 * Adds {@link Variables} for interpolation when loading key-values.
108                 * @param variables the variables to use for interpolation
109                 * @return this builder instance
110                 */
111                public Builder add(Variables variables) {
112                        this.variables.add(e -> variables);
113                        return this;
114                }
115
116                /**
117                 * Adds variables that will be resolved based on the environment. <strong>
118                 * Variables resolution order is the opposite of KeyValues. Primacy takes
119                 * precedence! </strong> This is useful if you want to use environment things for
120                 * variables that are bound to {@link KeyValuesEnvironment}. This is preferred
121                 * instead of just creating Variables from {@link System#getProperties()} or
122                 * {@link System#getenv()} directly.
123                 * @param variablesFactory function to create variables from environment.
124                 * @return this
125                 * @see Variables#ofSystemProperties(KeyValuesEnvironment)
126                 * @see Variables#ofSystemEnv(KeyValuesEnvironment)
127                 */
128                public Builder variables(Function<KeyValuesEnvironment, Variables> variablesFactory) {
129                        this.variables.add(variablesFactory);
130                        return this;
131                }
132
133                /**
134                 * Builds and returns a new {@link KeyValuesLoader} based on the current state of
135                 * the builder.
136                 *
137                 * <p>
138                 * If no sources are specified, a default classpath resource
139                 * {@code classpath:/system.properties} is used.
140                 * @return a new {@link KeyValuesLoader} instance
141                 */
142                public KeyValuesLoader build() {
143                        return loaderFactory.apply(this);
144                }
145
146                /**
147                 * Loads key-values using the current builder configuration.
148                 * @return a {@link KeyValues} instance containing the loaded key-value pairs
149                 * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during loading
150                 * @throws FileNotFoundException if a specified resource is not found
151                 */
152                @Override
153                public KeyValues load() throws IOException, FileNotFoundException {
154                        return build().load();
155                }
156
157        }
158
159}
